code:
import turtle

wn = turtle.Screen()
wn.bgcolor("green")

p2 = turtle.Turtle()
p2.color('blue')
p2.shape('turtle')
p2.penup()
p2.goto(-120,50)
p2.pendown()

guide.img: There are going to be 5 players in this game. Now that we have created the first player, Let’s go ahead and create our next player with the same logic
Create a player p2, setting the colour to blue and shape as turtle
guide.code:
import turtle

wn = turtle.Screen()
wn.bgcolor("green")

p2

guide.img: Keeping the x as the same as player 1, which is -120. Let’s just change the y to 50 since the y of the first player was 80. Therefore there will be a difference of 30 pixels between each player
guide.code:
import turtle

wn = turtle.Screen()

p2 = turtle.Turtle()

p2.shape('turtle')
p2.penup()
p2.goto(-120,50)
